data.title: Can't open big XML file with size ~2gb
data.body:
Hello everyone!

I start to use Atom and looks like in discussions in another issues the problem with big files was solved?

Now I try to open big XML file that has size ~2gb.
Then I open this file Atom show me popup window that he can hang for a while, I accept this, and after that - Atom crashed. 

Here is the Ctrl+C of crash window:

```
[Window Title]
Atom

[Main Instruction]
The editor has crashed

[Content]
Please report this issue to https://github.com/atom/atom

[Close Window] [Reload] [Keep It Open]
```

 Here u can download this big file: [ruwiktionary-latest-pages-articles.xml](http://dumps.wikimedia.org/ruwiktionary/latest/ruwiktionary-latest-pages-articles.xml.bz2) 

I use stock version of Atom 1.0.19 without any additional extensions.
My OS: win10 x64, 16gb RAM

data.title: Avoid leaking DOM objects
data.body:
With this PR we make sure to clear out all the references that caused `TextEditorComponent`s to be retained (e.g. closures, etc.). Below you can have a look at how the heap looked like after scrolling for a while on multiple editors and then closing them.

![screen shot 2015-10-07 at 11 09 04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/10333455/62597a46-6ce4-11e5-9b86-fefc036d4e29.png)

![screen shot 2015-10-07 at 11 16 35](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/10333550/f726adc4-6ce4-11e5-9a44-dd4a5fdc73ed.png)

As you can see, a lot of elements were leaking because they were still retained by `TextEditorComponent`.

This is how the heap looks after the changes in this PR:

![screen shot 2015-10-07 at 11 09 11](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/482957/10333477/88224b18-6ce4-11e5-83ff-313df800aa74.png)

:non-potable_water: :non-potable_water: :non-potable_water:

/cc: @nathansobo @atom/feedback for :eyes:

data.title: Reordering tabs is VERY laggy
data.body: Reordering tabs with drag-n-drop has become VERY laggy since Atom hits v1.x... I recall it used to work smoothly in v0.x.

data.title: Failed to activate the search package
data.body:
I get this error every time I start Atom.

**Atom Version**: 1.0.19
**System**: Mac OS X 10.11
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Failed to activate the search package

```
At Cannot read property 'command' of undefined

TypeError: Cannot read property 'command' of undefined
    at Object.module.exports.activate (<anonymous>:19:23)
    at Package.module.exports.Package.activateNow (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package.js:245:19)
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package.js:226:30
    at Package.module.exports.Package.measure (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package.js:169:15)
    at Package.module.exports.Package.activate (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package.js:218:14)
    at PackageManager.module.exports.PackageManager.activatePackage (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package-manager.js:486:21)
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package-manager.js:469:29
    at Config.module.exports.Config.transact (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/config.js:324:16)
    at PackageManager.module.exports.PackageManager.activatePackages (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package-manager.js:464:19)
    at PackageManager.module.exports.PackageManager.activate (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/package-manager.js:445:46)
```
### Commands

```
```


data.title: Inheriting from an existing grammar but excluding features on purpose
data.body:
I am trying to build up a grammar spec for AngelScript. AngelScript is heavily based on C++, so I want to add and remove specific features from C++. However, since the `#`-Macros are defined in both, C and C++, i would like to exclude these definitions alltogether. How do I do it? I tried to use an exclude statement - at least I gave it a try - but it di dnot do a thing.

What is to be done or is this even implemented?

Thanks!

data.title: View → Reset Font Size
data.body:
Clicking on `View → Reset Font Size` changes the font back to the previous font size.

Shouldn't this reset the font size back to the standard font size which is how other text editors (Notepad++ for example) work?

data.title: Allow grammar to override suggestedIndentForTokenizedLineAtBufferRow
data.body:
This would allow languages like Python to provide proper indentation. Current regex approach is not enough to provide proper PEP8 indentation:

``` python
foo = [
    'one', 'two']

bar = ['three',
       'four']


def bazzzz(
        param1,
        param2):
    pass


def icanhaz(bacon,
            cheezburger):
    pass
```

data.title: Rename dialog for a long path does not show the file
data.body:
When trying to rename a file `environments\production\modules\ltuk\files\users\oxle019\oxle019.bash_profile` the rename dialog shows up to the end of the first `oxle019`.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/572079/10305889/07266982-6c1b-11e5-91ff-57a4664b224a.png)

It would make more sense to have the text box scrolled to the end, so you can see the file that has been highlighted.

data.title: Cannot save readonly file
data.body:
When trying to save a readonly file I get an error:

```
Unable to save file 
EPERM: operation not permitted, open 'D:\file.h'
```

Atom version: 1.0.19
OS: Windows 7 x64

I'd expect to get a message box reporting about the readonly flag, and asking to overwrite the file anyway or cancel.

data.title: Atom crashes on install packages
data.body:
System details:
- Atom 1.0.19
- Windows 7

Whenever I go to "Install" to add packages, atom crashes after a couple of seconds with a windows error "The editor has crashed":
![crash](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5753990/10302524/558a937c-6c0d-11e5-910b-ccd56f754516.png)

Yesterday I got a new machine (very similar specs) and installed atom but it still happens.  It also happens in safe mode and nothing is logged to the console. I'm not sure how to debug it further.

data.title: Build Atom on openSUSE Tumbleweed
data.body:
Hi, I finally got the build successes on openSUSE Tumbleweed 64 bit. I followed carefully [the instructions](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/docs/build-instructions/linux.md) but I got errors (openssl, segmentation fault) and finally [a thread on the openSUSE forum](https://forums.opensuse.org/showthread.php/510005-Npm-throws-an-error) saved me:
- install `libopenssl1_0_0-hmac`
- replace nodejs with the version from [nodejs website](https://nodejs.org/dist/latest/).

data.title: Atom Helper 104% CPU Usage
data.body:
Atom Version: 1.0.19
OSX: 10.11 El Capitan

First time using Atom to create a simple website. I did not notice any lag on my other 2012MBP with 4GB and the default HDD, but on my 8GB and 250GB SSD I have noticed extreme amounts of CPU consumption.

The only packages I have installed is beautify, so I'm not sure what the issue is. I did read that some people were experiencing this when they created files directly on the desktop but I am not sure why this is happening.

Please tell me if I'm missing anything since this is my first issue submission!

![activitymonitor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12476080/10289903/01b68aba-6b6f-11e5-9b4d-1bf729ce51a0.png)

data.title: Dependency without permissive license: spdx-exceptions
data.body:
I'm currently seeing a check-licenses failure on master, for (ironically) spdx-exceptions:

```
Running "check-licenses" task
Found dependencies without permissive licenses:
spdx-exceptions@1.0.3
  License: CC-BY-3.0
  Repository: git+https://github.com/kemitchell/spdx-exceptions.json
```

At first glance, I suspect that this is related to kemitchell/spdx-exceptions.json#1.

data.title: Starting a HTTP server
data.body:
I wanted to create an atom plugin that would communicate with another server through HTTP requests. Failed to require express (unsafe eval error message), so required koa. But the problem with koa is that I can't get it to work with atom's commands. I just added 

``` javascript
koa = require "koa"
app = koa()
app.use ->
  @body = 'Server started from atom'
  editor = atom.workspace.getActivePaneItem()
  editor.insertText('Added this text from HTTP request')
app.listen(9911)
```

The server works, but everytime I visit it's url, I get a response with "Not found" body and no text is being added to atom. Also if I copy the code and run the server with atom code commented out, everything works fine. Maybe there is another way to communicate with "outside" world in atom or I should know something more about starting servers in atom?

data.title: Wrong cursor placement on Gnome HiDPI
data.body:
I'm struggling since I upgraded to Atom `1.0.19` (on Arch Linux) with wrong cursor placement. I have a 4k 60Hz monitor therefore I increased the Gnome `scaling-factor 2` (HiDPI). 

Here is a image of the visual cursor being placed wrongly after (on top) of the semicolon, while the real one is before the semicolon:

![wrong_cursor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3844203/10277477/68b3dc18-6b56-11e5-8ece-3fb2ec336969.png)

data.title: Close tab: save changes dialog: accept keypress "Y"/"N"
data.body:
When closing and not needing to store the changes made, I've trained muscle memory to do <kbd>Ctrl+F4</kbd> and then <kbd>N</kbd>, since this will close the (sub-)window and select the 'don't save' option from any 'Save changes first?' dialog with most editors. Except Atom. I've noticed the dialogs were modified to default Windows styling in a recent version, but still don't accept my pressing <kbd>N</kbd>. (On Windows it's typically done by writing `&` in the button labels, e.g. `Do&n't save changes`.
I'm on version 1.0.19 on Windows.

data.title: Pasting with a newline in front adds last lines indentation to pasted one
data.body:
Example ("-" are indentations, "\n" is a leading newline from the previous line):

```
\n
---copy me
```

```
---indented line <-- copied here, to an indented line
------copy me <-- will end up indented as such
---------copy me <-- when done again on above line
```

I expect:

```
\n
---copy me
```

```
---indented line <-- copied here, to an indented line
---copy me <-- should end up as such, not further indented
---copy me <-- when done again on above line
```

To reproduce, open a new (language independent) file and copy-paste as shown. I am not sure this works in all other languages (it does in C), because I don't know the extend of their potential interference. (But I guess so basic rule (regex?) is broken.)

I typically turn of all indentation management but in this case **it seems to happen regardless of the options** (Auto Indent, Indent on Paste, Normalize Indent on Paste) set. In my opinion, **it should (almost) never happen**, because we don't want to indent most expressions in programming, unless they are scoped. Likewise, for texts it makes no sense (to me).

So:
1) For auto indentation this seems wrong, the indentation should not increase.
2) For "Indent On Paste" (or any other indent options) set to false, it is a **bug**, because the indentation should never be touched at all.

Infos: Linux, atom 1.0.0, also tested with git repo version 1.2.0-dev (commit 4b507be99769a38e0b8e9b26a950fc408951f986)

data.title: Atom serializes DisplayBuffer scroll position correctly but overwrites it when re-opening workspaces
data.body:
Atom serializes the scroll position (`scrollTop` and `scrollLeft`) of each DisplayBuffer, but when you close a project / workspace and re-open it, it fails to restore the scroll position. This happens because the bounds check on `setScrollTop` doesn't have the correct data yet, and clamps every `scrollTop` value to 0:
https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/stable/src/display-buffer.coffee#L255

I'm not sure exactly what the fix should be:
- Delay applying scroll position until after the editor is attached and bounds are accurate.
- Apply the deserialized scroll position without a bounds check if the bounds are invalid.
- Do a third, better thing.

data.title: add option to choose whether atom rememebers your last windows and project folders
data.body:
A new Core Setting: **Restore Previous  Windows On Start**

Enabled by default, so it's backward compatible.

Fixes #6605

data.title: Show Invisibles: series of spaces at the center of line not shown
data.body:
Is this a bug or a feature?

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/504770/10267234/9e5944d6-6a8c-11e5-9421-7c5453408e8d.png)

 I can understand a single space is not displayed with a dot to improve readability, but series of spaces should in my opinion, at least starting from two or three. Especially when spaces are used to space tabular data.

data.title: 1.2.0-dev-e8b7a6b has bad permissions after install
data.body:
I updated npm and node on my dev machine, so I decided to fetch and rebuild atom against 4.1.1 node. After the build/install, atom would not run. I dug around and found  that /usr/local/bin/atom perms were  770:
`-rwxrwx---  1 root root     2725 Oct  3 22:25 atom` , along with most everything in /usr/local/share/atom:

```
$ ls -la /usr/local/share/atom/
total 93068
drwxr-xr-x 5 root root     4096 Oct  3 22:25 .
drwxr-xr-x 6 root root     4096 Oct  3 22:25 ..
-rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 55273184 Oct  3 22:25 atom
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root     4096 Oct  3 22:25 chromedriver
-rwxrwx--- 1 root root  9442207 Oct  3 22:25 content_shell.pak
-rwxrwx--- 1 root root 10207504 Oct  3 22:25 icudtl.dat
-rwxrwx--- 1 root root  2554248 Oct  3 22:25 libffmpegsumo.so
-rwxrwx--- 1 root root   520152 Oct  3 22:25 libgcrypt.so.11
-rwxrwx--- 1 root root 16237312 Oct  3 22:25 libnode.so
-rwxrwx--- 1 root root    31256 Oct  3 22:25 libnotify.so.4
-rwxrwx--- 1 root root     1055 Oct  3 22:25 LICENSE
drwxr-xr-x 2 root root     4096 Oct  3 22:25 locales
-rwxrwx--- 1 root root   410937 Oct  3 22:25 natives_blob.bin
drwxr-xr-x 4 root root     4096 Oct  3 22:25 resources
-rwxrwx--- 1 root root   569580 Oct  3 22:25 snapshot_blob.bin
-rwxrwx--- 1 root root        7 Oct  3 22:25 version
```

 I chmodded everything 755 and it started up just fine.
